channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chinese public is divided over whether to seek global dominance or share leadership
item.description: A new poll shows a majority of Chinese people see competition with the U.S. as a threat, but there is a split on what role Beijing should take on in t...

item.title: 'One and done' dose of LSD keeps anxiety at bay
item.description: People with generalized anxiety disorder improved significantly after they got a single dose of LSD powerful enough to induce a psychedelic trip.

item.title: Why the end of the de minimus tariff exemption is causing shipping chaos worldwide
item.description: Planet Money looks at what the de minimis tariff exemption is, who wins and loses with the end of this policy and why ending it has resulting in shipp...

item.title: The world's oldest and largest iceberg will soon be no more
item.description: The iceberg, known as A23a, has been on a journey following the current into warmer waters for months. Now, it has begun the predicted and natural pro...

item.title: For first Black woman to design cars for Ford, passion for cars was a family affair
item.description: In this StoryCorps, Emeline King, the first Black woman to design cars for the Ford Motor Company, remembers her inspiration: her father.

item.title: Putin rejects Western security in Ukraine, warning troops would be target
item.description: The Russian leader's refusal comes after 26 countries pledged to deploy troops to Ukraine in the event of a ceasefire.

item.title: Boy, 3, pulled from funicular crash that has shocked Portugal
item.description: It is unclear what caused the crash in which 16 people died and more than 20 were injured, including many foreign nationals.

item.title: Girls fell behind boys in math during the pandemic. Schools are trying to make up lost ground
item.description: Efforts to close the gender gap in STEM education are gaining momentum after setbacks during the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: 450 detained in raid by ICE, other agencies at huge Hyundai site in Georgia
item.description: The operation targeted one of Georgia's largest and most high-profile manufacturing sites, where Hyundai makes electric vehicles and is building an EV...

item.title: Zohran Mamdani challenges Trump to debate in New York City
item.description: Democrat Zohran Mamdani challenged President Trump to a debate in NYC after Andrew Cuomo called for a series of debates in the mayor's race.

item.title: Rubio says US will 'blow up' foreign crime groups if needed
item.description: The secretary of state made the comments during a trip to Ecuador, where he announced new measures targeting criminal gangs.

item.title: Trump administration investigates Medicaid spending on immigrants in Democratic states
Nationality of Lisbon funicular crash victims slowly emerging
item.description: At least one American was among the 16 people killed in a devastating electric streetcar crash in Portugal's capital, along with many other foreign na...

item.title: What we know about Lisbon's deadly funicular crash
item.description: At least 16 people died after a carriage on the city's famous Gl√≥ria hillside railway derailed.

item.title: Senate Democrats to probe firings of DOJ employees who worked for Jack Smith
item.description: Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee are asking Pam Bondi for records of at least 20 DOJ staff fired in August.

item.title: Lisbon funicular worker among those killed in crash
item.description: Four employees of a non-profit organisation and a transport worker are among those who died.

item.title: Couple who illegally kept rooftop-roaming panther learns their fate
item.description: The ruling follows a 2019 incident when the months-old feline was seen roaming a nearby rooftop after slipping out of the couple's window.

item.title: Ruth Paine, who opened her Texas home to Lee Harvey Oswald and shooed away conspiracies, dead at 92
